message_1: What are the quadratic residues of 17?
message_2:
A quadratic residue is a number that can be represented as a square of an integer modulo a prime number. To find the quadratic residues of 17, we need to calculate the squares of integers from 1 to 8 (half of 17 rounded down) modulo 17.

1² ≡ 1 (mod 17)
2² ≡ 4 (mod 17)
3² ≡ 9 (mod 17)
4² ≡ 16 (mod 17)
5² ≡ 8 (mod 17)
6² ≡ 2 (mod 17)
7² ≡ 15 (mod 17)
8² ≡ 13 (mod 17)

So, the quadratic residues of 17 are {1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 13, 15, 16}.
